enDesc: Bedikat HaSakin (“Checking of the Knife”) is a 13th-century treatise on the process of checking the knife used for ritual slaughter and checking an animal for defects or injuries that would render it a terefah (an animal disqualified from being kosher because of defects or injuries), by Rabbeinu Yonah Gerondi. It was first printed in the 19th century in the back of Teshuvot HaGeonim.
heDesc: מאמר הלכתי לרבינו יונה בענין שחיטה כשירה.
enShortDesc: 13th-century work on checking the knife used for slaughter and checking animals for defects.
heShortDesc: חיבור מן המאה ה-13 העוסק בסכין השחיטה ובבדיקת מומים בחיות הנשחטות.
